articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Turkey said on Monday its air force "neutralised" 26 Kurdish militants in strikes in Syria and northern Iraq in response to the killing of soldiers at the weekend, while authorities also detained dozens of pro-Kurdish opposition activists.
articles.title: Turkey retaliates at home, abroad after troops killed in Iraq

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The death toll in weekend attacks in the central Nigerian state of Plateau has risen to 113, a local official said on Monday, in a region where clashes between herders and farmers are common.
articles.title: At least 113 killed in attacks in central Nigeria, local official says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's government has proposed to parliament terminating a free trade agreement with Belarus, which supports Russia's invasion of Ukraine that began in February 2022, cabinet minister Taras Melnychuk said on Monday.
articles.title: Ukraine seeks to terminate free trade deal with Belarus

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran denied on Monday a U.S. claim that a drone launched from Iran had struck a chemical tanker in the Indian ocean.
articles.title: Iran denies US claim it targeted tanker near India

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A plane carrying 276 Indian passengers took off on Monday for Mumbai, the French interior ministry's local office said, after it was grounded for four days pending investigation into possible human trafficking.
articles.title: Plane passengers held pending human trafficking inquiry leave France for India

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A fire that broke out on Russia's only nuclear-powered icebreaker and cargo ship was promptly extinguished, the Murmansk branch of the emergency ministry said late on Sunday.
articles.title: Fire briefly breaks out on Russian nuclear-powered icebreaker

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Bassam Masoud, Dan Williams
articles.description: Pope Francis lamented the war in the Holy Land where Palestinian health officials said airstrikes killed at least 78 people on Christmas Eve in one of the Gaza Strip's deadliest nights in Israel's 11-week-old battle with Hamas.
articles.title: Israeli airstrikes kill dozens, Gaza officials say, in Christmas bloodshed

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli air strike outside the Syrian capital Damascus on Monday killed a senior adviser in Iran's Revolutionary Guards, three security sources and Iran's state media said.
articles.title: Israeli air strike in Syria kills senior Iranian Revolutionary Guards member

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge, Andrius Sytas
articles.description: Jailed Russian opposition politician Alexei Navalny has been tracked down to a penal colony north of the Arctic Circle, his spokeswoman said on Monday, after supporters lost touch with him for more than two weeks.
articles.title: Russia's Navalny tracked down to 'Polar Wolf' prison in the Arctic

articles.author: Jose Torres
articles.description: Thousands of migrants arrived on Sunday in the southern Mexican town Alvaro Obregon to spend the Christmas Eve in a public square without shelter before making their way north to cross the country and reach the border with the United States.
articles.title: Migrant caravan spends Christmas on the road before heading to U.S. border
